title: Tool Calling & Function Execution System
description:
Enable Consoul to execute tools (bash commands, Python code, file operations) requested by AI models with user approval workflows, security controls, and real-time result display.

## Vision
Transform Consoul from a chat-only interface into an interactive AI assistant that can take real-world actions through LangChain's tool calling API. Models like Claude 3.5, GPT-4, and Gemini can request tool execution, but all tools require explicit user approval with clear visibility into what will be executed.

## Goals
1. **Safety First**: Never auto-execute - always require user confirmation
2. **Provider Support**: Work with all LangChain tool-calling models (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Ollama)
3. **Extensibility**: Plugin architecture for custom tools
4. **Visibility**: Clear UI showing what tools will execute and their results
5. **Security**: Configurable whitelists/blacklists, timeouts, and sandboxing options

## MVP Scope (Phase 1)
- Tool registry and configuration system
- User approval modal with risk indicators
- Bash tool with strict safety controls
- Tool call detection in streaming responses
- Tool result display in chat view
- Conversation history with tool calls/results

## Future Phases
- Phase 2: Python code execution, file operations (read/write)
- Phase 3: Web search, HTTP requests, git operations
- Phase 4: Custom user-defined tools, plugin system
- Phase 5: MCP (Model Context Protocol) integration

## Security Principles
- Principle of least privilege
- Blocked commands by default (rm -rf, sudo, etc.)
- Timeout enforcement
- Human-in-the-loop for all executions
- Detailed audit logging
